caption: Good ambiance, drinks and food. Great music!
Great food, and service
Drinks were good and the bartender was nice.
Great drinks, good food, friendly staff
Good food and drink..Just very pricey..I seen The Rev.Jesse Jackson👁😳..Hyde Park
Very good food

It's a beautiful space within the Sophy Hotel. Delicious food, heady music piping from the sound system and great ambiance. If you are looking for a chill spot, a good meal and drinks in Hyde Park, this is it.
Food was spot on, loved the chicken sandwich with the honey Chipotle sauce.
Loved the chicken and waffles
Beautiful good service great food...keep in mind it's in a hotel.

Mesler is, somehow, still making food as delicious and flavorful as they were pre-COVID. From the fish to the fruit you can tell they’re still only using the freshest ingredients. Every interaction I’ve had with the staff has been extremely pleasant and properly distanced. George, Ryan and everyone else there are running a really tight ship, and putting out some really good food!
Luv et

I usually come on weekends for brunch and have a great experience the food service and atmosphere are all grade A. Today it was absolutely terrible. I called before I came to ask if the patio was heated and was told there were two fire pits as well as it being enclosed on three sides-it had neither. As my order was taken the waiter seemed frustrated, the waiter then disappeared and was nowhere to be found during the meal, he went on break I later found out. The employees were arguing multiple times over who should be where and when. I asked for a blanket that didn’t come until the meal was over. I asked for butter twice that didn’t come at all. I asked to come in to get the check and was told I could only for it to get taken out to a table I’d already left. I asked for a to go box and was only brought a bag. And at the end of my meal I was quite cold and underwhelmed. I was told sorry only by the chef after I had already complained and paid. I was offered no compensation only that if I came again the chef would take care of it. But the damage had been done and it should have been comped. Very dissatisfied.
Outside service wad poorly thought out.

A friend referred me & my wife to this restaurant and everything he said was on point!!! Traveling from Michigan was well worth the trip. Haven't had a breakfast like this in a long time!!!🤗 From the service , the food, hospitality and the very comfortable design of this restaurant. I will be back with more of my family!!!!
Food: 5 Service: 4 Value: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Overall: 4.75
Cozy chic atmosphere, great service, drinks, and snacks
A great place to host meetings, relax and work, or have fun with friends. The staff is always friendly and the food never disappoints.
Great food!!!
Depends on the chef. Some days it's seasoned to perfection and other days the food is bland. Try your luck on a Saturday people
Very classy and elegant place. Social distancing and covid guidelines are in place. Food was good and presentation was nice. Pricey yet worth the experience.

This is a wonderful spot in the Hyde Park neighborhood. Right in the middle of the action, yet it still feels like it's own oasis. The atmosphere and customer service were  wonderful. Our server gave us just the right amount of attention to ensure we felt cared for and still had space to connect and talk. Temperature checks were made at the door and a mask is required to be in the establishment and when you leave your table. Indoor and outdoor seating make for great options, and all seating is properly distanced from other restaurant goers. The food was lovely to look at and well plated though unmemorable in terms of taste. Portion sizes are nice and allow for easy sharing. The drinks were one of the best features...fun and well balanced (whoever was mixing that day, knew exactly what they were doing!! Everything was reasonably priced (for Chicago and COVID). Even though the food wasn't my favorite, I would definitely return again for the drinks and ambiance alone...I would also likely order something to eat...lol.
Always a favorite. This place is something special...i love it
The ambiance was amazing. The food was great and the service was even better. I definitely plan to go back.
Nice atmosphere with good food and drinks. Why not?
The service was very nice. We had lunch and the food was delicious and we received our food in a timely manner. I will definately return
Great service...good drinks
Great service and friendly staff
Amazing customer service here. And food comes out pretty quick. The drinks are drinkers! Well done all around staff!

Mesler Kitchen offers more than a chic sophisticated ambience, the menu has the perfect variety of entrée options. Don't skip on the cocktails like we did, live a little. We ordered the shrimp and grits, lobster roll and chicken with waffles. The weather was perfect so we opted for outdoor dining. Our waitress Lisa was attentive, provided great insight about our selections and made the experience enjoyable. The staff were also very upfront about the bees that would also be joining us while we dined. I guess they also know how sweet it can be to find a great spot to dine. The meal with no cocktails for a party of three was about $60. The lobster roll was the highlight of all three, the chicken that accompanied the waffles was flavorful and juicy, sometimes breast meat can dry out but they did it justice. The waffles were too sweet for my liking so don't add syrup, add very little or skip it altogether. Overall, we enjoyed dining at the Mesler.

Sunday Bruch was heavenly! I had a Denver Omelet with shrimp instead of sausage. The side salad was the perfect touch! He had pancakes, eggs, hash browns and maple chicken sausage. He's sleep now. But said it was really, really good! No line. No waiting. Safe distances. Masks are a must! Karin was our server, and she was worth our 20% grat! Our bill was a tad high as sleepy ordered a lot of food/OJ. This is a must when visiting Downtown Hyde Park onna Sunday!
Excellent venue and food. The service needs improvement.

One of my favorite restaurants and bar in Hyde Park. Clean, well designed space, My lovey and I go there several time, and every time enjoyed a lot. Like the toast, blue crab cake, chef soup, steak, lobster roll, cocktail...

Drinks are surprisingly potent and good. Bartender Alejandro made good drinks. Pineapple julep and mango margarita are excellent. Old fashion is a good drink too. Not really a fan of the cauliflower. Don't know whether ours was just over done but not great. Chicken wings were decent. Best appetizers is the crab cake.
Delicious drinks, fantastic food!
Service was excellent and the food was the same also the spot was amazing, beautiful very warm and comfortable.
Excellent service, loved patio seating, and pairing of lobster roll and wheat beer.

Overrated. Over priced. Cheese and meat board wasn't impressive. They put 2 slices of prosciutto and 3 slices of salami ..... not the most attractive charcuterie board. Our waiter was nice. But there was a rude employee there- he told us it was not allowed to stand around but wouldn't seat us lol TF? Took 20 minutes to be seated and we had a reservation. Won't recommend or return.
It's so pleasant, and beautiful atmosphere why you are eating your food, the food was delicious 💖

The manager Ryan ensured a wonderful experience. My questions were answered. I also appreciated the attention to detail and convenience of the Sophy Hotel being so close. A warm and welcoming setting that exudes class. I’ll be back for some more good food and drinks.
New spot in Hyde Park Chicago. Good after work spot
Nice cozy meal in a family atmosphere
The food is expensive and worth the wait. The wait staff is friendly helpful and kind.
Good vibe, great after work place within walking distance from home... downtown price, but without the elevated menu options....

I’ll just cut to the chase..the shrimp & grits was not all that. I have definitely had better. The grits were unseasoned and cooked in only water, and they were watery.  The service and ambiance were great. I’ll return, just not for the shrimp and grits.

The food was delicious. A tidbit on the high side for a la carte (for this area), but still a good experience. Great place for a fine meal in Hyde Park without breaking the bank at a downtown restaurant. Very culturally diverse crowds.
Smooth artful vibe, great bottomless cup of coffee and chef created menu. The roasted cauliflower was amazing!
Good place to eat and relax
Spot looks beautiful and services was great.  On my own opinion food wasn't tasty.
Service was slow, & Food was average. Decor was very nice and great crowd.

First off it would of been nice to have a hostess who smiled and made you feel welcome. Maybe she thought her youth and cuteness were enough. Luckily our server, David, was very engaging and knowledgeable. I liked the decor of the main dining room. The books on shelves are a nice touch. The food unfortunately didn't show the same finesse. The Chef seems a little heavy handed with the salt in the seafood and pasta dish I ordered. The crab cake was a tragedy. Flavorless with a too soft texture. The only highlight was the roasted cauliflower. A dish like that makes the idea of being vegan almost tolerable. I did like the diverse set of patrons especially some of the most vibrant beautiful African Americans I've seen seated at the bar. Maybe next time I'll just have a drink and people watch.
Great food and large portions.
Drinks are great, food is mostly good, the steaks aren’t the best
Pretty good! Very pretty space, and very well, priced, tasty foods for brunch. Lots of vegetarian options, too!

I tried Mesler for restaurant week with a few of my girlfriends over the weekend. The restaurant esthetically was quite beautiful and inviting but the service and food fell flat. From start to finish most of the staff seemed confused.  When we checked in they could not find the reservation. While ordering our first waitress did not seem educated on the menu.  After waiting to place our order we received a new waitress. After placing my order all of the dishes came out except for mine. The waitress forgot to place my order. All of entrees we tried were extremely bland. We had high hopes for this place maybe we will try dinner.
Great atmosphere, service and entrees!
Breakfast for lunch? Yes, pls!
Delicious entrees and excellent service !
I love the chic and chilled atmosphere. The food and service is great.
Nice place
Excellent service, great prices.. beautiful place to dine.

Visited Thanksgiving for last brunch of the day. First time and can't say enough good things about the experience. Our wait staff was manager on duty, Sharon who made what turned out to be amazing food & drink suggestions. The Shrimp & Grits are worthy to be authentically compared to NOLA. The 5th Ward Burger was top notch with caramelized onions and fresh cut fries. Sharon was attentive and very informative about the Mesler itinerary. Can't wait to visit again. 👍🏾
A touch of comfy sophistication with great food and cocktails. Work with LaMar if you can.
Great food GREAT service
Mesler Kitchen was wonderful! Great experience, delicious food, super nice staff and ambiance.....superb!
Great staff! Good food!

So went for Brunch for the first time, with about 20 other teachers, this past Friday. The hostess, who actually turned out to be my server, was very welcoming and knowledgeable. She recommended an excellent drink, The Ruby something, can’t remember the full name. Because I’m allergic to seafood, had to substitute the shrimp for fried chicken in the Shrimp & Andouille sausage & Grits meal. It was delectable! Also tried the waffle; melted in my mouth.  Just have to add that my server was very accommodating and ensured that not only my, but my colleagues’, experience was an enjoyable one; mission accomplished! I will definitely patronize Mesler again!

Well this was me and husband first time there tonight for the bears tailgate party.  I bought VIP tickets for the event.  There was a area in front of my group that had a fireplace,  which was warmer than where we were sitting.  I asked a young caucasian lady with black her, who was suppose to be a manager for the patio area  if we could sit there if the ppl don't show up... she stated NO, because they paid for the seats.  Okay so did I and I was the first one there.  That was kool. So 4 ppl who work there and was probably off work,  say in the area I asked about,  drinking free from ther bar.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.. don't think I will be returning or recommending this establishment.

Enjoyed Brunch at Mesler. Had the chicken and waffles and they were the best I’ve had. Trust I’ve had some of the best: Roscoes, Gladys, Chicago Chicken and Waffles... etc. Mesler has a great chicken and waffles dish. Bottomless Mimosas, shrimp and grits and salads completed our meal for two. Great time! Good service.

The food was AWESOME. I had the Super Grains (highly recommended). The ambiance is fine, you know, your typical loud hotel lobby bar/restaurant, but nothing too crazy.  The challenge, and the reason I am giving it only three stars is the service timeliness. My server was super nice and kind... But it took her forever to bring even water, drinks, and food. At any given point I saw 2-3 people going around the tables, yet it consistently took 20+ minutes for any order to be brought. I doubt it was a kitchen bottleneck, because drinks were also impacted. Not saying I won't come again, but I hope management looks into this to fix it. It hurts the experience.

Great food, drinks, ambiance, and service! Mesler is a nice, upscale location to grab drinks and food in Hyde Park. I’ve been here a couple of times for late night drinks and some afternoon refreshments, and had great experiences. The service is warm and attentive, and the food is as good as any restaurant you would find downtown! I’ve tried a variety of dishes, sides, and drinks, and while the portions are on the smaller side, I have been surprised by how good they are.  I love the variety of seating options they have, and how many couches and nice seats you can find here. It’s also a comfortable place to pull out a laptop and do some work outside of meal service hours. Mesler seems to be busy at every time of day, but especially at night, which makes it always a fun oasis to hang out in the neighborhood.
New Restaurant very unique drinks and food

I'm a Hyde Parker, so this is one of my go to spots where the food, cocktails and services is always good. I've tried most things on the lunch/brunch menu and none have been bad at all. My favorite dish is the lobster roll or veggie hash. While my fav cocktails are the Sidecar Rotation and Hemingway Adaptation.
Love the atmosphere

I visited Mesler for the first time last night and I was shocked by this cool, artsy spot! I live in the area and remember the hotel and restaurant opening but I hadn’t had the chance to check it out until now. The host was warm and welcoming, our server Olivia was delightful and knowledgeable. She suggested the cauliflower appetizer and oh my GOSH it was delicious. The drinks were okay. I’ll definitely be back.
Great cocktails and ambiance. No happy hour specials
Pretty brunch selection here! Really need to try the chicken and waffles if you have not yet

Had an a awesome girls night out with two of my friends. We sat in the private area outside in the back. Didn't like the idea to have to spend a certain amount to sit there but, the menu is kinda pricey so we spent well above the required amount. I would suggest they serve guests bread prior to the meal. Furthermore, I suggest tiki torches to repel bugs during summer months. Yet, food, decor & ambiance was good. Parking can be tricky depending on the day due to the congested area. Be prepared to Valet just in case! Awesome place though, great crowd.

I really thought I was being punked. That's how interesting my experience was at this place. Beautiful place, but my table had a dirty cup on it with lipstick stains and the rest of my evening went downhill. My server was very pushy and spoke over my group every time he approached us. He never said excuse me, he literally cut off whoever was talking as he approached our table. The manager seemed to be very spaced out, but made sure that we were not charged for the cheese tray that was served to my table with old hard cheese. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. The bar section was pretty live. Restaurant, was a no.
Small portions, pricier, but decent service and ambiance.
username: Just a Fashion Girl from Chicago

caption: Downtown atmosphere right here in Hyde Park.
Everything you hate about gentrification & yet you will still enjoy it.

A very nice option for brunch in Hyde Park. The menu is very fairly priced given the amenities you are paying for. The staff was extremely attentive without being gauche and took care to greet and say farewell to all of their guests. A special hank you to our server Jocean for taking good care of us, she was responsive and had a kind energy. The space is beautiful and tastefully designed while maintaining an inviting ambience. I do think the menu could be further developed but the coffee was pretty good for Hyde Park, and the pancakes were literal perfection.
The bucatini will change you! Get it with the seafood and thank me later.
(Translated by Google) Rental atmosphere  (Original) Ambiance location
Great new upscale restaurant in Hyde Park. The drinks are made to order. Not watered down. The food was very tasty. Although it doesn't have much of a variety.
username: Monique Washington -Think Monique Real Estate Group

caption: Very nice relaxing place
Fantastic ambience and food...
We recently had our second dinner here and couldn’t be happier. Great cocktails and food in a classy space, and Lamar provided us spectacular service. Highly recommend if you are in hyde Park.
The service is consistently poor, the drinks are average (at best) and it is obvious they are understaffed. Overall, a disappointment.
Overpriced
The ambience was perfect for date night with the Mrs. Our server Lamar did a great job informing us of some delicious food choices on the menu.👍👍👍

Came for drinks and came for lunch. Exquisite and calming spot, very sophisticated. People there alone, groups and couples. Drinks very good, food good. Staff very friendly. A great elegant space for dinner or drinks. Not overcrowded.

From the moment we walked in, we were graciously greeted by Eva and had an absolute amazing experience. Sheron was very attentive, and informative. Would definitely recommend this spot just based off of decor and menu selection, however the service is phenomenal!!
Beautiful decor, great service!
Very good food, a bit pricey & a bit slow on the service
Excellent drinks, good bar food, and fine service.

Creative menu with beautiful presentation. The Cauliflower and Deviled Eggs, Chicago Style (nice touch!) appetizers were delicious. Pork Porterhouse was moist and flavorful. Super Grains were well balanced and very satisfying. Our table service by Lamar and his support staff was attentive and his personality very engaging without being intrusive. Oh, did I mention the drinks?! No? Well crafted and delicious!

5 star for atmosphere and drinks, 2 star for service. The servers are nice but really slow and inattentive. It is clear that they are not well trained. They could also use vegan and vegetarian options on the menu (they have one dish with kale and faro that you can order without egg and french fries).  That said, it is very comfy and decor is beautiful.
Great wait staff.First timer. Great vibe. Kitchen closes at 10 and place closes at 11 but they still served way past 11. They still let us get dinner at 950 and was great. Will be back.

Went to Mesler for Valentine's dinner with my wife.  The service was excellent, and the food was great.  The dining area is separated from the bar/lounge area, which creates a intimate atmosphere.  We'll definitely be going back.
Good brunch/lunch menu, warm decor, good noise level for conversation.
food was good. but service was slow and it wasn't crowded, waitress forgot our drink.
The food was really good, the atmosphere was well decorated, contemporary and comfortable and best of all, every single person that worked there was nice and personable. I will be going back.
Had a dissert there, very good.
Beautiful ambiance and great customer service
First visit. Girlfriend and I camefor cocktails. Wonderful, friendly service and decent prizes. Decorum is chill and inviting!
Excellent meal!  Lemar was first rate as our waiter tonight.  We will definitely be back!

Twice in two weeks. The staff was courteous and attentive. The drinks were tasty as was the food. The bartender was easy to banter with over brunch. The ambience is perfect especially for a frigid day. Shall return soon.
Excellent service, attentive bartender and Host. Shrimp and Grits are a must-have.
Stopped in for a quick cocktail. Was really good!
Great menu! Great service. (Thanks Lamar!) The food was impeccably presented and was delicious. Haven't yet stayed in the hotel. Next staycation.

The waiters on Meslers were extremely nice and accommodating. Very easy to spark a conversation with them and the restaurant and ambiance itself was very very nice. Beautiful retro artwork and cozy lighting. The food was fantastic, I had a crab cake as an appetizer which was delicious, as was the filet it was very tender and very well seasoned. I'd highly recommend going here for a date night.

I was pretty excited to get a new restaurant in Hyde Park and made our way here after the place being open for a few months. It's been a fairly big disappointment considering how beautiful the decor and hotel is.  The food was average and definitely does not align with their price point. The thing that really stuck out and took away from our experience was the service and lack there of.  We came at a slow time before the kitchen had opened for a few drinks and ordered food 20 minutes after the kitchen had opened. Getting any kind of attention was an extreme chore. Our drinks were empty for half the night, and the next visit after our food was dropped off was with the bill. We wanted something to go with our frites as they forgot any ketchup or aioli but we were never approached.

There on a Sat afternoon for drinks and appetizers with another couple..cool vibe, great service, and tasty food.  Between the four of us we had the filet, the hamburger, the crab cake, and the beet salad. Everyone was pretty happy with their meal and the drinks were very good too.  Wonderful energy to the place:  open and airy,  while sleek and modern.
Chic and conservative spot, love the food. Don’t forget to make a reservation, it’s common courtesy:)
Nice spot to hang out
Great handmade cocktails with infused spirits. Go for the warm vibe (may be due to the fireplace).
So came here for date night and it’s amazing. Just what Hyde park needed. The bartender is a great and the bar fare is perfectly light. We had the pork rinds, wings, and blue crab cakes. Superb
lovely place

Pros: amazing food, great atmosphere, relatively inexpensive (brunch with drinks for less than $25 bucks/person)  Cons: Staff seemed a little distracted, and kept forgetting parts of our meal. They also were down a bartender, so no cocktails. When we attempted to make our own mimosas they were also out of prosecco -.-' Not great for brunch.

Awesome brunch place!  Lookout Promontory! I'm never going back to you for brunch with your pretentious menus and overpriced food.  The chicken and waffles are great. Mesler Mary has the perfect spiciness. Good coffees!  This place surely gives Promontory the competition it needs. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food and the atmosphere.  Be sure to make a reservation, as this place will be popular when people realize that it's here!
Great atmosphere and really good food. Can't wait until they fully open!
